channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Lockdown: Jeremy Corbyn's brother issued with fixed penalty notice
item.description: Piers Corbyn, 73, called the fine an 'abomination' and an 'attack on human rights' after he refused on numerous occasions to heed the police's polite requests in Central London today.

item.title: Two former U.S. special forces charged with terrorism and conspiracy over failed Venezuelan coup
item.description: Luke Denman, 34, and Airan Berry, 41, were charged with 'terrorism, conspiracy, illicit trafficking of weapons of war and (criminal) association' for their alleged role in a failed Venezuelan coup.

item.title: Elon Musk says Tesla HQ 'will move to Texas or Nevada immediately'
item.description: The disgruntled CEO took to a comment thread on Twitter to share that he was also planning to file a lawsuit against Alameda County.

item.title: Polar Vortex blasts the northeastern US as latest snow ever is recorded in New York's Central Park
item.description: Polar Vortex has blasted into the northeast with record low temperatures, winds and snow. Mt. Washington has a low of just 10 degrees, while Death Valley, California, is could reach 110 degrees.

item.title: Campaigners oppose plans for skyscraper that 'would block view of the Tower of London'
item.description: Historic Royal Palaces has argued that the project will block protected views of the tower which is part of a system introduced in 1938 to also guard views of St Paul's vistas and the Palace of Westminster.

item.title: Couple wear masks with SWASTIKAS on them while grocery shopping in California
item.description: Dustin Hart, who goes by Dusty Shekel on social media, posted a 14-minute clip of his encounter in a Santee Food 4 Less on Bit Chute - a video hosting platform that appeals to the far right.

item.title: Couple die in agony after home brewing their own lockdown beer
item.description: South African couple Tony Hilliar, 54, and Alida Fouche, 42,died after making their own illicit supply of beer to get around their country's strict alcohol ban imposed since the Covid-19 lockdown.

item.title: At least 227 migrants arrive in UK after crossing English Channel including 50 on an inflatable boat
item.description: Another group of migrants were intercepted by Border Force officers in Kent today. This follows a group of 145 migrants being found on eight inflatable boats on Friday, a new single-day record.

item.title: NHS is already building a new Covid-19 contact tracing app
item.description: Developers from Google and Apple have been brought into the fold to provide technology that will overcome incompatibility issues with some mobiles reported on the Isle of Wight.

item.title: Police 'fighting a losing battle' as Britain's parks are packed with sunworshippers amid 79F heat
item.description: Flouters ignored lockdown to drink wine and 'eat pizza' in London Fields park in Hackney, London. Temperatures hit 26C (78.8F) as most of the country basked in heat higher than St Tropez.

item.title: Trump accuses Democrats of 'trying to steal another election'
item.description: President Trump accused Democrats in California of attempting to 'steal another election' on Saturday

item.title: Gordon Ramsay goes shopping with son Jack amid backlash for flouting lockdown
item.description: The chef, 53, was spotted loading the purchases into his car around Polzeath and Rock, after taking to Instagram earlier in the day to share a glimpse of his home's spacious gardens.

item.title: Samantha Cameron's father is robbed after thief 'reached into his car and grabbed his iPhone'
item.description: Sir Reginald Sheffield, Samantha Cameron's father, was targeted in the grounds of Normanby Hall near Flixborough outside Scunthorpe, in an alleged tussle with a man accused of stealing his iPhone 8.

item.title: Man who filmed Ahmaud Arbery slaying claims he was only a 'witness' as he says he is getting threats
item.description: William 'Roddie' Bryan was seen for the first time since his cellphone footage exposing the shooting of Ahmaud Arbery, 25, was leaked this week.

item.title: Richard Branson clears way to sell half his £1.6billion stake in Virgin Galactic
item.description: The Virgin Group boss came under fire last month for asking the UK government for £500million of support for his airline businesses, which have been paralysed in the pandemic.

item.title: Rishi Sunak 'making final decision on future of furlough scheme this weekend'
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak will make a final decision this weekend on when and how to phase out the government's coronavirus furlough scheme, it was claimed today.

item.title: Little Richard dead at 87: Rock music legend behind Tutti Frutti passes away
item.description: Rock music legend Little Richard has died at the age of 87, his family have confirmed. The star, whose hits included Tutti Frutti, Long Tall Sally, and Good Golly Miss Molly, inspired a generation of musicians.

item.title: Spain's 24-hour death toll plummets with just 179 new Covid-19 fatalities
item.description: Spain's Health Ministry confirmed 721 new cases and 179 deaths from Covid-19 in the last 24 hours, among the lowest increases since the outbreak of the pandemic in March.

item.title: Rapist dubbed the Beast of Kavos strikes again
item.description: The 'Beast of Kavos', who was previously named as 47-year-old Dimitris Aspiotis (pictured left) , was given early release in August 2019, under a controversial new law.

item.title: Firefighters rescue Duchess the horse stuck in mud after falling into ditch
item.description: A team of firefighters worked tirelessly for three hours to rescue a horse named Duchess who had fallen into a ditch in Great Horkesley, near Colchester on the Friday of bank holiday.

item.title: Brits say they're not being squashed by lorries and bad hair days by cycling to work
item.description: The Mayor of London has come under heavy fire for failing to increase capacity on the Tube ahead of an expected rise in passengers as the Prime Minister looks to ease people back to work.

item.title: Parkgoer gives Boris Johnson a piece of his mind as he plans to get Britain back to work
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson was confronted by a member of the public as he walked through St James's Park this morning. This was the fourth time this week the PM has been seen holding a coffee cup.

item.title: Government to urge people to cycle or walk to work - and wear face masks
item.description: Grant Shapps warned there will be no 'single leap to freedom' after the coronavirus lockdown is lifted as he warned it will be a long time before the UK's transport network returns to normal.

item.title: Belarus 'bribes people' to attend Victory Day parade to upstage Putin's Russia as 5,000 troops march
item.description: Hundreds of Belarusians, including Second World War veterans, attended a Victory Day parade in Minsk on Saturday that marked the 75th anniversary of the allied victory over Nazi Germany.

item.title: Britain announces hundreds more coronavirus deaths
item.description: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps revealed the figures, which include fatalities in all settings, at tonight's Downing Street press briefing.

item.title: Obama blasts Trump's handling of coronavirus pandemic as 'an absolute chaotic disaster'
item.description: Barack Obama (right), the former president, said on Friday that President Trump's (left) handling of the COVID-19 pandemic is one reason he will work hard to help Joe Biden defeat him in November.

item.title: Chinese minister says nation's health system has 'shortcomings'
item.description: Deputy director of China's National Health Commission Li Bin said that reforms are underway to improve the country's disease prevention and control mechanisms.
item.media:credit: The Asahi Shimbun via Getty Imag

item.title: Indian pharmacist dies after drinking chemical mix they made to come up with coronavirus treatment
item.description: K Sivanesan, 47, and his colleague Rajkumar worked for a herbal medicine company and tested their treatment - a mix of nitric oxide and sodium nitrate - at a home in southern Chennai city.

item.title: French resistance heroine who helped liberate Paris from the Nazis has died aged 101
item.description: Cecile Rol Tanguy (pictured) died yesterday at her home in Monteaux, central France, as Europe commemorated the 75th anniversary of the surrender of Nazi Germany to Allied forces.

item.title: Black Lives Matter protesters demonstrate at petrol station where police Tasered father
item.description: A group of up to 15 people observed Covid-19 social distancing rules as they gathered at a petrol station forecourt in Stretford, Manchester, where the incident took place.

item.title: Russian troops are using drones to track down members of failed Venezuelan coup, local media claims
item.description: El Nacional published allegedly deleted tweets from state military command ZODI La Guaira center which claimed that Russian special forces members were aiding the search for coup members.

item.title: Travellers will be quarantined for TWO WEEKS and face £1,000 fines if they break rules
item.description: From June, all arrivals in the UK - including returning Britons - will be quarantined for two weeks and face £1,000 fines or deportation if they fail to do so.

item.title: Police arrest 40-year-old murder suspect after 67-year-old woman was found dead at her home
item.description: The woman was found dead in her home in Levenshulme, Manchester, by emergency services who rushed to the property around 8.30pm on Thursday.

item.title: Lawyers warn lack of PPE could result in corporate manslaughter charges
item.description: Lawyers have warned the lack of PPE for NHS and care workers could result in corporate manslaughter charges as 54 Covid-19 healthcare deaths were reported to the Health and Safety Executive.

item.title: Mother-to-be is accused of 'abuse' by her in-laws for wanting to name her son Gaylord
item.description: The anonymous woman, 23, believed to be from the US, told Reddit users how she and her husband, 24, are expecting their first child in August but have had a major disagreement on what to call him.

item.title: Tinder catfish scam saw 16 women show up to the same Sydney live gig to meet 'Ruby'
item.description: Ruby, 27, told her Tinder matches she would meet them for a single date at Cafe Lounge for a live music gig at 7pm on Wednesday June 5.

item.title: Rolls-Royce latest £405,000 Black Badge SUV attracts younger customers with black Spirit of Ecstasy
item.description: The debut of Rolls-Royce's £405,000 Cullinan Black Badge has attracted a younger brand of car buyers with the average age of Rolls-Royce customers falling to 42-years-old.

item.title: Man, 38, is arrested on suspicion of murder after woman 'falls from fourth-storey window'
item.description: A woman in her 40s was found dead after emergency services were called to Greenall Court in Prescot, Merseyside, at around 3.30am on Saturday. A man, 38, was arrested at the scene.

item.title: Greggs reopens shops to customers in latest good news for locked-down Britain
item.description: The Newcastle-based baker is back selling coffee, pasties and cakes to customers in-store at an undisclosed number of shops in the Tyneside area as new safety measures are trialled.

item.title: Boy, 16, fights for life after he was hit by TWO hit-and-run drivers while riding his bike
item.description: Police were called at just after 11pm last night to a collision involving a cyclist on Streatham High Road, south west London. Two men in their 20s have been arrested in the local area.

item.title: 'Dedicated and loving' nurse dies of coronavirus after five weeks fighting for life on ventilator
item.description: 51-year-old 'dedicated and loving' nurse Onyenachi Obasi died after fighting for her life for five weeks on a ventilator in intensive care. Her niece has set up a fundraising page to pay for her funeral.

item.title: French tourist escapes death by punching a shark which attacked him while surfing at a popular beach
item.description: Dylan Nacass, 23, managed to escape with only minor lacerations after a shark latched onto his leg while he was surfing at Bell's Beach in regional Victoria on Friday afternoon.

item.title: Royal Navy veteran says he was 'treated like a leper' after coronavirus hospital discharge
item.description: Veteran Robert Embleton, 79, was left devastated by residents' response when he returned to his Plymouth retirement home after beating coronavirus in hospital.

item.title: Married Welsh man wins harassment case after female colleague repeatedly pestered him for sex
item.description: An employment tribunal in Llandudno, Wales, ruled Andrew Weatherby, 50, was sexually harrassed by a female coworker. It heard that she threatened to make 'his life hell' if he reported her to his boss.

item.title: So bad they're good! Amateur photographers share wildlife snaps which didn't turn out as planned
item.description: People from around the world have taken to social media to share their unfortunate attempts at capturing a magnificent shot of nature, with the photos being collated by Bored Panda.

item.title: Belgians have to choose just FOUR friends or relatives to visit their home as nation eases lockdown
item.description: 'Buddy system' is to be introduced tomorrow on Belgium's Mothering Sunday. Similar ideas are being contemplated in the UK.

item.title: Should we drop our offer on a house because of coronavirus?
item.description: We don't want to gazunder the seller, but also we don't want to harm our own finances and pay over the odds at a time of economic uncertainty.

item.title: 'Off-grid' mother likens lockdown to a 'Nazi regime' and REFUSES to clap for the NHS
item.description: Adele Allen, 36, who lives in Brighton with her husband Matt, slammed hardworking doctors and nurses on Facebook, accusing them of attention-seeking by sharing videos of dance routines.

item.title: Warmer weather does NOT kill off coronavirus: Two separate studies dash hopes for summer
item.description: US and Canadian researchers said the transmission risk was only reduced by about 1.5 per cent for every degree Fahrenheit above 77F (25C). They analysed 370,000 cases of the virus.

item.title: Workers could get legal right to work from home in 'workplace revolution'
item.description: Whitehall officials are modelling the plans on rules that already allow new parents to request flexible working. It will make it easier for those who do go in to the office to socially distance.

item.title: Kate Garraway given hope amid husband Derek's battle with COVID-19 as fans share stories of recovery
item.description: The GMB presenter, 53, thanked a fan for telling her about her own husband's survival of the deadly bug, following a seven-week stint in intensive care

item.title: Brainteaser challenges YOU to find the 14 accidents hidden in the home
item.description: A new brainteaser, created by National Accident Helpline, challenges the nation to find the 14 household items that can cause injury in the home - but can you beat the 23 second record?

item.title: Emma Stone sparks fan speculation she is secretly MARRIED
item.description: Emma Stone has sparked speculation she has secretly married fiancé Dave McCary.

item.title: London pub fan lovingly recreates his local hostelry in virtual reality
item.description: Tristan Cross spent two and a half weeks building Skehans in Nunhead, south London, using Unreal Engine 4 gaming software.

item.title: Marking the 200th anniversary of Florence Nightingale's birth - her life in fascinating objects
item.description: Britain's Florence Nightingale is known for revolutionising nursing. As medics fight the coronavirus pandemic, her work resonates. Here, we celebrate her life with a collection of objects.

item.title: Harry Potter star Miriam Margolyes admits she wanted PM Boris Johnson to DIE of COVID-19
item.description: The actress, 78, made the shocking comments in a rant on Channel 4 comedy chat show The Last Leg on Friday night.

item.title: South Korea shuts down nightclubs after new coronavirus spike is blamed on clubbers last weekend
item.description: The measures imposed Saturday by Seoul Mayor Park Won-soon came after the national government urged venues around the nation to close or otherwise enforce anti-virus measures,

item.title: Sol Campbell spreads crazy conspiracy theory that coronavirus may have been man-made
item.description: The Southend manager asked if the virus deliberately attacks a certain blood type. The strange tweet drew criticism from a range of Twitter users.

item.title: Honda Jazz driver, 91, surrenders his licence after terrifying motorists
item.description: The pensioner's silver Honda Jazz was captured on dashcam hurtling towards oncoming traffic on the A30 near Sherborne, Dorset, at 4.30pm on April 27.

item.title: Professor Lockdown should NOT have resigned over secret trysts with his mistress say epidemiologists
item.description: Experts have slammed a 'misconception' that one single scientist was the 'architect of the lockdown' and single-handedly convinced the government to introduce drastic social distancing measures.

item.title: Driver's bid to throw £25,000 of cocaine from his van fails when he forgets to open window
item.description: Officers from Devon and Cornwall Police stopped the driver on the M5 and when they got to the cab they discovered the inside was covered in white powder.

item.title: Andre Harrell dead: Legendary music executive has died aged 59
item.description: Andre's cause of death currently remains unknown but sources confirmed to Variety on Friday that he had passed away.

item.title: Ribblehead viaduct threatens to collapse after walkers hit by falling rubble
item.description: The 145-year-old grade II structure has developed defects which are causing masonry to plunge off the edge. Engineers have discovered fractures along its 24 arches, which tower 100ft above ground.

item.title: Top Russian scientist trying to clone Ice Age woolly mammoth dies suddenly from heart attack
item.description: Dr Semyon Grigoryev, 46, had been leading the research into the remains of the Ice Age beasts, frozen for tens of thousands of years in the Siberian permafrost.

item.title: Exploring Florence Nightingale's home and the London museum dedicated to her on her 200th birthday
item.description: Her former family home in Derbyshire is now a B&B - you can stay in her bedroom. And the museum in London that's dedicated to her has made 200 objects available to view online.

item.title: Suspect, 23, will appear in court charged with murder of man killed for his £7,000 Rolex watch
item.description: Danny Pearce, 31, was stabbed and allegedly shot at by two thugs on a scooter after he left a jazz club in Greenwich, south-east London in 2017.

item.title: Former Conservative minister Rory Stewart recalls his travel adventures
item.description: The politician recalls his travel adventures including nearly being arrested in Nepal when he was accused of being in Al-Qaeda just after 9/11 - and eating his most unpleasant meal, in China.

item.title: Private detective, 56, who conned Madeleine McCann's parents out of £300,000 died in fall
item.description: Kevin Halligen, 56, ran Oakley International, which received the publicly donated cash after Madeleine McCann vanished from Praia da Luz in Portugal aged three in 2007.

item.title: Mother-of-two, 32, creates stylish Merino wool blanket in lockdown
item.description: Rosanna McKean, 32, from Bristol, followed a 13-minute YouTube tutorial to create a grey Merino wool blanket for her modern living room while in lockdown, which cost £70 fo the materials.

item.title: 'Two thirds of coronavirus cases in Britain are going undiagnosed'
item.description: Professor Tim Spector, a leading genetic epidemiologist, said the failure to class common symptoms in with the dry cough and fever has led to statisticians collecting data which is 'nonsense'.

item.title: Son surprises dad on 70th birthday with tune on piano after learning to play in secret for a decade
item.description: TV producer and chief executive of WhizzKid Entertainment Malcolm Gerrie, from Newcastle upon Tyne, had no idea why he'd been invited onto BBC Breakfast until his son Olly surprised him.

item.title: Is THIS the dress of the summer? Fashionistas go wild over comfortable New Look smock
item.description: Fashion fans and influencers from across the UK are raving about the black-and-white checked dress from New Look, with many saying they 'need' it for their summer wardrobes.

item.title: Last member of The Few from Battle of Britain has 'luck of the Irish'
item.description: John 'Paddy' Hemingway, at age 100, is the last member of The Few, a crew of RAF pilots who protected the UK from the Luftwaffe over the English Channel in 1940.

item.title: Controversial trials to infect healthy volunteers with covid IS justified, says WHO
item.description: So-called challenge trials are common in vaccine development, but only for viruses which have treatments. It comes as scientists around the world race to find a Covid cure - including two in the UK.

item.title: Killing Eve's evil inspiration: The real crimes that inspired Villanelle's onscreen murders
item.description: Dressed in braces and bow tie, with frizzy hair and a bulbous red nose, assassin Villanelle (Jodie Comer) arrives at a children's party to make balloon animals (episode two, series three).

item.title: Queen's VE Day 75th Anniversary speech praises lockdown spirit
item.description: Her Majesty spoke from Windsor Castle at 9pm today as she celebrated the everyday heroism of the wartime generation and the British people battling coronavirus during the national crisis.

item.title: Social media users get creative in a new challenge that involves making dresses from shopping bags
item.description: People from across the world have taken to Instagram with creative snaps of outfits they've made using shopping bags as part of a new viral challenge.

item.title: The Mail reveals it's a female former friend suing Duke and Duchess of York for a £6.7m unpaid debt
item.description: The original owner, said to be a female beneficiary of a trust fund, is believed to have sold Chalet Helora to the Yorks in 2014 for 22m Swiss francs (£18m). They owe her £6.7m and she decided to go to court.

item.title: Woman who battled cystic acne for nearly a decade cures it during lock-down
item.description: Lucy Morris, 22, from Surrey battled cystic acne for almost a decade and was left with depression due to her medication but has cured it during lock-down after finding a line of 'miracle' products.

item.title: The winners of the German GDT Nature Photographer of the Year competition have been revealed
item.description: A stunning picture of a hare standing in a field at dusk has won the German Society for Nature Photography's 2020 Nature Photographer of the Year contest.

item.title: Queen surrounded by wartime mementos for VE Day speech
item.description: On the desk in front of the Queen was her Auxiliary Territorial Service (ATS) khaki-coloured peaked cap - part of her uniform when she undertook National Service as a teenage princess in February 1945.

item.title: World's 'oldest man' celebrates 116th birthday more than 100 years after Spanish flu killed sister
item.description: Centenarian Fredie Blom was born on May 8, 1904, in Adelaide near the Great Winterberg mountain range of South Africa's Eastern Cape province. He celebrated his 116th yesterday.

item.title: Garden centres OPEN: Customers will return next week as the lockdown eases
item.description: Garden centres will be allowed to reopen next week under Boris Johnson's plans to ease the lockdown.

item.title: Unions threaten to scupper plans to reopen schools by June 1
item.description: Government sources have indicated Boris Johnson wants schools to begin to reopen on June 1, although unions have expressed concern about safety. TUC's Frances O'Grady is pictured.

item.title: Adele shows off dramatic weight loss and ALISON BOSHOFF reveals how she picked her look from pals
item.description: ALISON BOSHOFF: Adele, 32 this week, posed for stunning photos in which her 10 st weight loss was evident. So what is behind her makeover, and who's in the glam squad behind her transformation?

item.title: Now a member of Mike Pence's staff tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence's spokesperson Katie Miller, who also serves as a spokesperson for the White House Coronavirus Task Force, tested positive for the coronavirus..

item.title: UK companies 'will have to provide face masks for all who return to work'
item.description: The PM is expected to recommend people wear them in the office, on public transport and when shopping despite not making them compulsory in England.

item.title: Prince William and Kate Middleton chat to veterans on VE Day
item.description: Prince William, 37, and Kate Middleton, 38, made a video call to residents of an East Sussex care home on Wednesday. They giggled as the WWII veterans shared their VE Day memories.

item.title: Lockdown could be needlessly prolonged because of ministers' obsession with 'irrelevant' R-value
item.description: The Government is relying on the 'R' figure - the average number of people a coronavirus patient infects - to tell them when it is safe to unlock the UK. But experts have said the measure it is 'too crude'.

item.title: E-scooters trials to allow them on the roads to be fast-tracked
item.description: The government hope that battery-powered electric scooters - which can travel up to 30mph and cost between £200 and £500 - will offer an alternative to public transport after coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Why you should have home insurance if you house share
item.description: Daisy, 22 (pictured) didn't get any of her deposit back from her landlord after one of her housemates accidentally broke the bathtub whilst they were living together.

item.title: Is a final financial order on divorce always final?
item.description: The court made 40,000 financial orders last year. There will be a concern that allowing some people to reopen their financial order now will lead to hundreds or thousands of similar claims.

item.title: Australia's 'organisational queen' reveals foolproof way to tidy up kitchen sink and bathroom vanity
item.description: An Australian 'organisational queen' has revealed her best tips for keeping your kitchen cupboards, bathroom vanity and toy room clean with the help of IKEA and Kmart tubs.

item.title: Prince Harry surrounded by Meghan Markle's friends in LA villa
item.description: Several of her closest friends live near the vast £14.5million villa the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have moved into in star-studded Beverly Hills with its famed 90210 postcode.

item.title: The Sex Clinic expert Sarah Mulindwa returns to the NHS frontline to help battle the COVID-19 crisis
item.description: The 34-year-old model, who is the star of Channel 4's The Sex Clinic, has put her career on hold to look after coronavirus patients.

item.title: PLATELL'S PEOPLE: Vulgar LA mansion is a stain on the Duke and Duchess of Sussex
item.description: AMANDA PLATELL: We learned that they have chosen as their LA hideaway, a Tuscan-style mansion amid 14 acres in a gated community in one of the most sought-after areas of Hollywood....

item.title: 70000 are stuck on cruise ships during pandemic as unpaid crews beg to go home
item.description: Tens of thousands of crew members worldwide are still on cruise ships out at sea. Workers are confined to cabins aboard ships and most of them are no longer being paid after contracts expired.

item.title: Tekashi 69 breaks Instagram record with 2M viewers of his livestream after release from jail
item.description: Tekashi 69 just broke the record for Instagram Live viewers as he broadcast an epic rant on Friday after his release from jail.

item.title: JOHN HUMPHRYS: An asteroid could be heading for Earth and yet our leaders are at war with each other
item.description: JOHN HUMPHRYS: Every leader of every country in the world had come together on a virtual network. Never had there been such a conference. But, yet, never had there been such a crisis.

item.title: Hospitals probed after sending elderly back to care homes despite KNOWING they had coronavirus
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The elderly patients sent back from hospitals, despite suffering from coronavirus, triggered outbreaks in care homes, tragically claiming the lives of other vulnerable residents.

item.title: Obama says 'rule of law' is at risk following DOJ's decision to drop charges against General Flynn
item.description: Former President Barack Obama (seen left with then-President-elect Donald Trump at the White House in 2017) on Friday blasted the decision to drop the case against ex-NSA Michael Flynn (right).

item.title: Legendary Vegas magician Roy Horn Siegfried and Roy dies at 75 after coronavirus battle
item.description: Legendary magician Roy Horn has died. He was 75. Horn,one half of the longtime Las Vegas illusionist duo Siegfried & Roy, had tested positive for COVID-19.

item.title: Winston Churchill's granddaughter reveals her mother's mercy dash
item.description: On the evening of May 8, 1945, Winston Churchill could have been forgiven a little merry-making.

item.title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry flown on private jet to LA
item.description: Tyler Perry sent his private jet to whisk Prince Harry and Meghan Markle to LA in a top secret, early morning enterprise on March 14, DailyMail.com has learned exclusively.

item.title: Hatton Garden gang hand back less than a TENTH of the £27million they were ordered to repay
item.description: Brian Reader, 81, was ordered to pay £6.5million but has only repaid £406,072. Three other members of the gang have also underpaid following the 2015 £14million London heist.

item.title: Tom Watson supported fantasist Carl Beech - yet became boss of UK Music and industry demand answers
item.description: Tom Watson's appointment as chairman of UK Music has triggered an extraordinary backlash, with insiders warning of a shattering split as they demand evidence of his qualifications for the role.

item.title: Wifelets at war!
item.description: The passing of one of Britain's most colourful aristocrats last month has cast a pall of sorrow across the Longleat estate, where they are mourning for the late Marquess of Bath.

item.title: Chemicals found in kitchenware can DOUBLE your risk of obese grandchildren, research shows
item.description: The Public Health Institute in California found that obesity was up to 2.3 times higher among 20-year-old women whose grandmothers had been exposed to syn chemicals.

item.title: Schoolgirl, 13, wins court fight forcing Oxfordshire council to scrap transgender 'toilets toolkit'
item.description: Oxfordshire County Council introduced the advice for transgender pupils last year, saying they should be able to use the toilets of their identified gender. The council has withdrawn the advice.

item.title: Bail-out billions anaesthetise us from reality but our economy is in tatters
item.description: DR JOHN LEE: The survival of the British economy, the very future of our society and the hopes of generations to come will depend upon Boris Johnson's words.

item.title: Netherlands schools will have plastic screens fitted on desks as they begin to reopen next week
item.description: Dutch schools have been closed since March 14 and will reopen on May 11. Teachers at the Springplank in Den Bosch say they 'are not worried'. There have been 5,359 deaths in the country.

item.title: Man, 57, is arrested on suspicion of murder after body of woman in her 40s is found in a flat
item.description: The victim, a woman in her 40s, was found in the property in Reigate, Surrey shortly before 7am on Friday. Officers confirmed that the victim's next of kin have been informed about her death.

item.title: Constipated lizard found with poop making up 80 PERCENT of its body mass thanks to its greasy diet
item.description: Researchers discovered the tubby lizard near a Cocoa Beach pizza parlor in Florida with a record-breaking case of constipation - a glob of feces made up 80 percent of its body.

item.title: Craig Revel Horwood tells why he decides to wed again
item.description: The Strictly star said he knew Jonathon was the one on their first date and decided to marry again after Jonathon helped him plant a garden to remember the love he had for his father.

item.title: PPE pirates shamelessly buy up vital safety gear and ramp up prices for NHS and carers
item.description: Shameless opportunists are buying up supplies of personal protective equipment and hiking prices by as much as 10,000 times, a Mail investigation has found.

item.title: Australian business launches infrared sauna blankets
item.description: The Australian MiHIGH product allows customers to enjoy the benefits of an infrared sauna in the comfort of their own home and bed.

item.title: Man is nearly crushed by a SUV when he is thrown from the vehicle as it flips three times
item.description: A man in Hanahan, South Carolina, was nearly crushed by a SUV after he was thrown from the car as it flipped over.

item.title: Deceptively difficult emoji quiz puts your knowledge of capital cities to the test
item.description: Nikki Spiers, 31, who lives in London, is known for creating social media's viral emoji quizzes. She has posted a new challenge, asking puzzlers to name 20 capital cities using emojis.

item.title: Ash dieback disease plaguing British forests could be stopped by hedgerows
item.description: Scientists from the British Ecological Society found the fungal disease is far less severe in the isolated landscapes such as in hedgerows.
